thread.title: Snowstorm shuts down schools and roads in northeast England
thread.title_full: Snowstorm shuts down schools and roads in northeast England

title: Snowstorm shuts down schools and roads in northeast England
text:
Next Article
Snowstorm shuts down schools and roads in northeast England
India
A major snowstorm swept through northeast England on Thursday, leading to school closures and travel chaos.
The Met Office put out a yellow warning for snow and ice until 9pm.
Several schools, like Lockwood Primary in Saltburn, had to close, while the headteacher at Duchess's Community High School said he tried to get into town by various routes but it was becoming increasingly unsafe to do so.
Travel delays hit hard
The A1 between Morpeth and Alnwick is jammed up with trucks blocking the road, causing long delays.
Public transport isn't spared eitherâ€”Arriva North East's service 81 had to be suspended because busses kept getting stuck near Dunsdale.
All in all, it's been a rough day for getting around or heading to class in the region.
